min3d.core
Class Object3d

java.lang.Object
  min3d.core.Object3d
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnimationObject3d, Object3dContainer
public class Object3d
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the basic building block for user interface components. A Object3d occupies a polygon area on the screen and is responsible for drawing and event handling.

animationEnabled

public boolean animationEnabled()
Indicates whether animation is enabled or not. If it is enabled then this should be an AnimationObject3d instance. This is part of the Object3d class so there's no need to cast anything during the render loop when it's not necessary.

Returns:
true if object animation is enabled

animationEnabled

public void animationEnabled(boolean $b)
Determines if animation will be enabled. If it is enabled then this should be an AnimationObject3d instance. This is part of the Object3d class so there's no need to cast anything during the render loop when it's not necessary.

Parameters:
$b - true to make object animation enabled

vertexColorsEnabled

public boolean vertexColorsEnabled()
Indicates if per-vertex colors will be using for rendering object. If false, defaultColor property will dictate object color. If object has no per-vertex color information, setting is ignored. Default is true.

Returns:
true if per-vertex colors will be using for rendering object

vertexColorsEnabled

public void vertexColorsEnabled(java.lang.Boolean $b)
Determines if per-vertex colors will be using for rendering object. If false, defaultColor property will dictate object color. If object has no per-vertex color information, setting is ignored. Default is true.

Parameters:
$b - true to make per-vertex colors be used for rendering object

normalsEnabled

public boolean normalsEnabled()
Indicates if object will be rendered using vertex light normals. If false, no lighting is used on object for rendering. Default is true.

true to make object be rendered using vertex light normals

ignoreFaces

public boolean ignoreFaces()
When true, Renderer draws using vertex points list, rather than faces list. (ie, using glDrawArrays instead of glDrawElements) Default is false.

Returns:
renderer draws using vertex points list, rather than faces list

public void ignoreFaces(boolean $b)
When true, Renderer draws using vertex points list, rather than faces list. (ie, using glDrawArrays instead of glDrawElements) Default is false.

Parameters:
$b - true to make that Renderer draws using vertex points list, rather than faces list

pointSmoothing

public boolean pointSmoothing()
Indicates if point smoothing enabled (anti-aliasing), applicable when renderType is POINT. When true, points look like circles rather than squares. Default is true.

Returns:
true if point will be applied smoothing

pointSmoothing

public void pointSmoothing(boolean $b)
Enabled point smoothing (anti-aliasing), applicable when renderType is POINT. When true, points look like circles rather than squares. Default is true.

Parameters:
$b - true to make that point will be applied smoothing

lineWidth

public float lineWidth()
Return line width. (applicable when renderType is LINE) Default is 1. Remember that maximum line width is OpenGL-implementation specific, and varies depending on whether lineSmoothing is enabled or not. Eg, on Nexus One, lineWidth can range from 1 to 8 without smoothing, and can only be 1f with smoothing.

Returns:
return line width

lineWidth

public void lineWidth(float $n)
Set line width. (applicable when renderType is LINE) Default is 1. Remember that maximum line width is OpenGL-implementation specific, and varies depending on whether lineSmoothing is enabled or not. Eg, on Nexus One, lineWidth can range from 1 to 8 without smoothing, and can only be 1f with smoothing.

Parameters:
$n - line width

lineSmoothing

public boolean lineSmoothing()
True if line smoothing enabled (anti-aliasing), applicable when renderType is LINE. Default is false.

Returns:
true if line will be applied smoothing

lineSmoothing

public void lineSmoothing(boolean $b)
Enabled line smoothing (anti-aliasing), applicable when renderType is LINE. Default is false.

Parameters:
$b - true if line will be applied smoothing

customRenderer

public java.lang.Boolean customRenderer(GL10 gl)
Can be overridden to create custom draw routines on a per-object basis, rather than using Renderer's built-in draw routine. If overridden, return true instead of false.

dispatchTouchEvent

public boolean dispatchTouchEvent(Ray ray,
                                  MotionEvent event,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<Object3d> list)
Pass the touch screen motion event down to the target object, or this object if it is the target.

Parameters:
ray - a geometric ray from the touch
event - The motion event to be dispatched
list - the touched object(ray intersected ones)
Returns:
True if the event was handled by the object, false otherwise.

isClickable

public boolean isClickable()
Indicates whether this object reacts to click events or not.

Returns:
true if the object is clickable, false otherwise
See Also:
setClickable(boolean)

setClickable

public void setClickable(boolean clickable)
Enables or disables click events for this object. When a object is clickable it will change its state to "pressed" on every click. Subclasses should set the object clickable to visually react to user's clicks.

Parameters:
clickable - true to make the object clickable, false otherwise
See Also:
isClickable()

isLongClickable

public boolean isLongClickable()
Indicates whether this object reacts to long click events or not.

Returns:
true if the object is long clickable, false otherwise
See Also:
setLongClickable(boolean)

setLongClickable

public void setLongClickable(boolean longClickable)
Enables or disables long click events for this object. When a object is long clickable it reacts to the user holding down the button for a longer duration than a tap. This event can either launch the listener or a context menu.

Parameters:
longClickable - true to make the object long clickable, false otherwise
See Also:
isLongClickable()

isPressed

public boolean isPressed()
Indicates whether the object is currently in pressed state. Unless setPressed(boolean) is explicitly called, only clickable objects can enter the pressed state.

Returns:
true if the object is currently pressed, false otherwise
See Also:
setPressed(boolean), isClickable(), setClickable(boolean)

setPressed

public void setPressed(boolean pressed)
Sets the pressed state for this object.

Parameters:
pressed - Pass true to set the object's internal state to "pressed", or false to reverts the object's internal state from a previously set "pressed" state.
See Also:
isClickable(), setClickable(boolean)

performClick

public boolean performClick(java.util.List<Object3d> list,
                            Number3d coord)
Call this object's OnClickListener, if it is defined.

Returns:
True there was an assigned OnClickListener that was called, false otherwise is returned.

isInScrollingContainer

public boolean isInScrollingContainer()

getHandler

public Handler getHandler()
Returns:
A handler associated with the thread running the object. This handler can be used to pump events in the UI events queue.

post

public boolean post(java.lang.Runnable action)

Causes the Runnable to be added to the message queue. The runnable will be run on the user interface thread.

This method can be invoked from outside of the UI thread only when this object is attached to a window.

Parameters:
action - The Runnable that will be executed.
Returns:
Returns true if the Runnable was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting.

postDelayed

public boolean postDelayed(java.lang.Runnable action,
                           long delayMillis)

Causes the Runnable to be added to the message queue, to be run after the specified amount of time elapses. The runnable will be run on the user interface thread.

This method can be invoked from outside of the UI thread only when this object is attached to a window.

Parameters:
action - The Runnable that will be executed.
delayMillis - The delay (in milliseconds) until the Runnable will be executed.
Returns:
true if the Runnable was successfully placed in to the message queue. Returns false on failure, usually because the looper processing the message queue is exiting. Note that a result of true does not mean the Runnable will be processed -- if the looper is quit before the delivery time of the message occurs then the message will be dropped.

removeCallbacks

public boolean removeCallbacks(java.lang.Runnable action)

Removes the specified Runnable from the message queue.

This method can be invoked from outside of the UI thread only when this object is attached to a window.

Parameters:
action - The Runnable to remove from the message handling queue
Returns:
true if this object could ask the Handler to remove the Runnable, false otherwise. When the returned value is true, the Runnable may or may not have been actually removed from the message queue (for instance, if the Runnable was not in the queue already.)

performLongClick

public boolean performLongClick(java.util.List<Object3d> list,
                                Number3d coord)
Call this object's OnLongClickListener, if it is defined. Invokes the context menu if the OnLongClickListener did not consume the event.

Returns:
True if one of the above receivers consumed the event, false otherwise.

refreshDrawableState

public void refreshDrawableState()

onFilterTouchEventForSecurity

public boolean onFilterTouchEventForSecurity(MotionEvent event)
Filter the touch event to apply security policies.

Parameters:
event - The motion event to be filtered.
Returns:
True if the event should be dispatched, false if the event should be dropped.
